name: ✍️ Ditto | collaborate on copy
description:
Manage the text on your mockups from design to production with a single source of truth.


Ditto integrates with Figma and your codebase to act as a single source of truth for everyone touching copy — from writers to designers to engineers.


You can use the Figma plugin to:

  • 🚦 Track progress and review status
  • 🌐 Build a text component database/library
  • Manage translations (for i18n and i10n)
  • 📜 View detailed edit history of your text
  • 👯‍♂️ Make bulk edits to duplicate text
  • 💬 Comment on specific pieces of text and @mention/notify teammates
  • 🔍 Search text across your mockups
  • 🔄 Sync text to a central repository
  • 🛠️ Hand copy off to engineers (who can use our API/CLI instead of copy + pasting)
  • ↗️ Export text to JSON, CSV, or XML


Here's a sample workflow using Ditto:

  • Connect your Figma mockups to Ditto to sync all the text into a new Ditto project.
  • Edit text (and add status, tags, and notes) in the Ditto web app or our Figma plugin. Use Ditto's Figma plugin to pull in any edits made in the web app to the Figma file.
  • Comment and @mention (notify) teammates to get their review on copy as it's being written.
  • Create and re-use existing text from your Ditto component library to save time and establish consistency.
  • Create Variants in Ditto for translations, copy explorations, custom messaging for user segments, etc.
  • When copy is ready, mark it as "Final" using Ditto.
  • Developers can either fetch the copy directly from their command line using our API/CLI, or download the copy as a CSV, JSON, or XML. They'll be able to integrate them into their codebase any way they'd like.


Getting started

To get started, open up this plugin in any file. Click Sign in and follow the instructions to create a Ditto account and get access to the Ditto web app. See this guide for more detailed instructions.
